description: BLOOMSBURG- Bloomsburg University of Pennsylvania has announced its plans to offer a modified academic calendar for the fall semester. Bloomsburg University will continue to adhere to health and safety guidelines from the Pennsylvania Department of Health and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, as well as directives from the Governor's...
text:
Bloomsburg University

BLOOMSBURG - Bloomsburg University of Pennsylvania has announced its plans to
offer a modified academic calendar for the fall semester. The modified
calendar begins on Monday, Aug.t 17, and ends Tuesday, Nov. 24, and
prioritizes the health and safety of the entire campus.

The plan also maximizes the use of classrooms for instruction while following
social distancing guidelines, and allows for flexibility should there be a
resurgence of COVID-19 outbreaks during the coming year.

Bloomsburg University will continue to adhere to health and safety guidelines
from the Pennsylvania Department of Health and the Centers for Disease Control
and Prevention, as well as directives from the Governor's Office and the
Office of the Chancellor regarding the reopening of campus.

The semester will begin one week earlier than initially planned, and will
consist of two six-week sessions in combination with a 12-week term. The full
schedule to include finals week will be released as the new schedule is built.
One-third of all courses will be offered within one of three sessions. The
university will also offer a six-week online winter term.

Capital University

BEXLEY, Ohio \- Briana Shervinskie, of Sunbury, was among nearly 600 graduates
who received their degrees from Capital University during the 2019-20 academic
year. Shervinskie received a Bachelor of Arts.

Kutztown University

KUTZTOWN - Seven area students have been named to the spring dean's list at
Kutztown University. To be eligible for the dean's list, an undergraduate
student must be registered for at least 12 credits and have a minimum grade
point average of 3.60.

Area students are, Aleah Brianne Alderson, of Locust Gap; Tanner Michael
Karycki, of Mount Carmel; Erica Ranae Oden, of Sunbury; Jessa N. Paczkoski, of
Shamokin; Madison Dawn Pancher, of Shamokin; Cory Joseph Sanko, of Gordon; and
Madelyn Elizabeth Witkoski, of Kulpmont.

York College

YORK \- Three area students were named to the dean's list at York College of
Pennsylvania. To be eligible for this honor, a student must be registered for
at least 12 academic credit hours and earn a semester GPA of 3.50 or higher.

Students are, Hannah Chiboroski, of Sunbury; Josiah Cottle, of Sunbury; and
Caitlyn Lichtel, of Elysburg.

Central Penn College

SUMMERDALE \- The following students have been named to the Central Penn
College dean's list for the winter term. Gina Huntsinger, of Ashland; and
Angela Piaggio, of Trevorton.

Bucknell University

LEWISBURG \- The following local students graduated from Bucknell University
at its commencement on May 17. Elyse Noll, of Elysburg; Mary Scopelliti, of
Elysburg; and Chloe Poltonavage, of Shamokin.

Wilkes University

WILKES-BARRE \- Wilkes University awarded 720 bachelor's, master's and
doctoral degrees at a virtual degree conferral ceremony on May 16. A second
virtual degree conferral occurred on May 29 for students receiving the Doctor
of Pharmacy degree in the Nesbitt School of Pharmacy.

Local students receiving degrees are Michael Bergamo, of Kulpmont, Bachelor of
Business Administration in finance; Nathan Hunter, of Elysburg, Doctor of
Pharmacy; Sarah Metzinger, of Ashland, Doctor of Pharmacy; and Dane
Tarantelli, of Gordon, Bachelor of Arts in history.

East Stroudsburg University

EAST STROUDSBURG - Two local students named to the dean's list at East
Stroudsburg University of Pennsylvania for the spring semester are Tiffany
Lapotsky and Shane McGrath, both of Ashland.

title: College News
